page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: Agricultural land is owned by two large Estates-Lothian and Duke of Buccleugh and is mainly let on a permanent{tenancy basis.}More recently farms have been let on a'partnership' with the landlord maintaining a nominal share. The land is mainly high quality light loam and farm size is typically 200/240ha. {Livestock}Breeding and fattening cattle units mainly continental type eg. Charolais, Limousin to meet market demand for leaner meet. There are few breeding sheep but some wintered and fattened on break crops-turnips and rape. Also large intensive pig unit. {Cropping}Intensive Cereal, high pro- portion of winter sowen wheat and barley. Also specialised pearl-barley Other crops potatoes, peas, oil seed rape. Hay and silage grown for fodder. { }
